CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Civil proceedings;Article 6-1 - Fair hearing);Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property (Article 1 para. 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Peaceful enjoyment of possessions)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants , who are husband and wife , were born in DATE and DATE , respectively , and live in LOC , GPE .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicants emigrated from the GPE to GPE and obtained NORP nationality . Before emigrating , they were receiving old - age pensions from the NORP authorities . Once the applicants left the GPE , the payments were discontinued in accordance with the GPE pension law in force at the material time .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants brought civil proceedings against the competent regional department of ORG of GPE ( Пенсионный Фонд Российской PERSON ) ( hereinafter “ the ORG ” ) seeking reinstatement of their right to the pension payments .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE found in the ORG favour and ordered ORG to set up DATE pension payments backdated to DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment on appeal and it became binding and enforceable .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG lodged an application for supervisory review , seeking to have the judgments quashed . The application was addressed to the President of ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE a judge of ORG requested the case file from ORG and subsequently suspended enforcement of the judgment of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE another judge of ORG sent the case for supervisory review to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the supervisory review application and endorsed the judgment of DATE , as upheld on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG lodged another application for supervisory review , again addressed to the President of ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE a judge of ORG sent the case for supervisory review by ORG of ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the judgment of DATE , as upheld on DATE , and rejected the ORG claims .
